# Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct

## Our Pledge

In the interest of fostering an open and welcoming environment, we as
contributors and maintainers pledge to making participation in our project and
our community a harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of age, body
size, disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity and expression,
level of experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal
appearance, race, religion, or sexual identity and orientation.

## Our Standards

Examples of behavior that contributes to creating a positive environment
include:

* Using welcoming and inclusive language
* Being respectful of differing viewpoints and experiences
* Gracefully accepting constructive criticism
* Focusing on what is best for the community
* Showing empathy towards other community members

Examples of unacceptable behavior by participants include:

* The use of sexualized language or imagery and unwelcome sexual attention or
 advances
* Trolling, insulting/derogatory comments, and personal or political attacks
* Public or private harassment
* Publishing others' private information, such as a physical or electronic
 address, without explicit permission
* Other conduct which could reasonably be considered inappropriate in a
 professional setting

## Our Responsibilities

Project maintainers are responsible for clarifying the standards of acceptable
behavior and are expected to take appropriate and fair corrective action in
response to any instances of unacceptable behavior.

Project maintainers have the right and responsibility to remove, edit, or
reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, and other contributions
that are not aligned to this Code of Conduct, or to ban temporarily or
permanently any contributor for other behaviors that they deem inappropriate,
threatening, offensive, or harmful.

## Scope

This Code of Conduct applies both within project spaces and in public spaces
when an individual is representing the project or its community. Examples of
representing a project or community include using an official project e-mail
address, posting via an official social media account, or acting as an appointed
representative at an online or offline event. Representation of a project may be
further defined and clarified by project maintainers.

## Enforcement

Instances of abusive, harassing, or otherwise unacceptable behavior may be
reported by contacting the project team at birgit.hassler@dlr.de or
alistair.sellar@metoffice.gov.uk. All
complaints will be reviewed and investigated and will result in a response that
is deemed necessary and appropriate to the circumstances. The project team is
obligated to maintain confidentiality with regard to the reporter of an incident.
Further details of specific enforcement policies may be posted separately.

Project maintainers who do not follow or enforce the Code of Conduct in good
faith may face temporary or permanent repercussions as determined by other
members of the project's leadership.

## Attribution

This Code of Conduct is adapted from the [Contributor Covenant][homepage], version 1.4,
available at https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/1/4/code-of-conduct.html

[homepage]: https://www.contributor-covenant.org

For answers to common questions about this code of conduct, see
https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq

# Contributions are very welcome

Please read our [contribution guidelines](https://docs.esmvaltool.org/en/latest/community/index.html).
If you would like to contribute a new diagnostic or feature, please have a look at our [contribution guidelines](https://docs.esmvaltool.org/en/latest/community/index.html).
ESMValTool: A community diagnostic and performance metrics tool for routine evaluation of Earth system models in CMIP

ESMValTool is a community-developed climate model diagnostics and evaluation software package, driven
both by computational performance and scientific accuracy and reproducibility. ESMValTool is open to both
users and developers, encouraging open exchange of diagnostic source code and evaluation results from the
Coupled Model Intercomparison Project [CMIP](https://www.wcrp-climate.org/wgcm-cmip) ensemble. For a
comprehensive introduction to ESMValTool please visit our
[documentation](https://docs.esmvaltool.org/en/latest/introduction.html) page.

result.name: Version 2 beta release 4

result.description:
This release includes

Bug fixes
- Fix case of no zero crossings for QBO metric computation (#1290) [Valeriu Predoi](https://github.com/valeriupredoi)
- Cmorizer wrapper now uses the in-built logger configuration and outputs stdout to out and stderr to err (#1514) [Valeriu Predoi](https://github.com/valeriupredoi)
- Took out fx_files from recipe albedolandcover (#1521) [bascrezee](https://github.com/bascrezee)
- Fix monthly time for era-interim-land (#1504) [bascrezee](https://github.com/bascrezee)

Diagnostics
- Quantilebias working for only a single dataset (#1511) [Jost von Hardenberg](https://github.com/jhardenberg)
- Added more plotting and saving options for recipe validation (#1490) [Valeriu Predoi](https://github.com/valeriupredoi)
- eWaterCycle: Add recipe to prepare input for PCR-GlobWB (#1349) [Jaro Camphuijsen](https://github.com/JaroCamphuijsen)
- Fix hard-coded path in recipe_runoff_et.yml (#1526) [Mattia Righi](https://github.com/mattiarighi)
- eWaterCycle: Add recipe to prepare input for HYPE (#1334) [Inti Pelupessy](https://github.com/ipelupessy)
- Miles: fill occasional missing values (#1528) [Jost von Hardenberg](https://github.com/jhardenberg)
- Upgrade pcrglob recipe and diagnostic. (#1531) [Peter Kalverla](https://github.com/Peter9192)
- Changes to zmNAM diagnostic  (#1540) [fserva](https://github.com/fserva)
- Replace extract_slice with extract_transect in diagnostic_transects.py (#1569) [Valeriu Predoi](https://github.com/valeriupredoi)
- Add SeaIce Drift metric (#1079) [Javier Vegas-Regidor](https://github.com/jvegasbsc)

Documentation
- Better default configuration (#1509) [Bouwe Andela](https://github.com/bouweandela)
- Documentation: added running pro tips (#1317) [Valeriu Predoi](https://github.com/valeriupredoi)
- Remove mention of obsolete mailing list. (#1556) [Björn Brötz](https://github.com/bjoernbroetz)

Observational and re-analysis dataset support
- Add CMORizer for MAC-LWP (#1507) [Birgit Hassler](https://github.com/hb326)
- Add CMORizer for CALIPSO-GOCCP (#1524) [Axel Lauer](https://github.com/axel-lauer)
- ERA5 CMORization by recipe (#1432) [Peter Kalverla](https://github.com/Peter9192)
- Add CMORizer for MLS (hur, hurStderr) (#1508) [Manuel Schlund](https://github.com/schlunma)
- Add CMORizer for Era-Interim va and ta daily data (#1544) [Evgenia Galytska](https://github.com/egalytska)
- Add CMORizer for gpcc (#1550) [mwjury](https://github.com/mwjury)
- Add CMORizer for cowtan way (#1552) [mwjury](https://github.com/mwjury)
- Add CMORizer for CDS-SATELLITE-ALBEDO (#1541) [bascrezee](https://github.com/bascrezee)

Improvements
- Convert reference entries to bibtex files (#1498) [SarahAlidoost](https://github.com/SarahAlidoost)
- Add communities and grant to zenodo file (#1512) [Mattia Righi](https://github.com/mattiarighi)
- Fix broken recipes and tests due to new ESMValCore release v2.0.6b (#1523) [Peter Kalverla](https://github.com/Peter9192)
- Change order of julia packages (#1535) [Jost von Hardenberg](https://github.com/jhardenberg)
- replaced 1:length(x) by seq_len statements (#1489) [chrisdane](https://github.com/chrisdane)
- Use Julia environment for running Julia diagnostics (#1557) [Bouwe Andela](https://github.com/bouweandela)
- Increase version to v2.0.0b3 (#1568) [Bouwe Andela](https://github.com/bouweandela)
result.name: Version 2 beta release 3

result.description:
This release includes

Diagnostics
- Use master as the default branch (#1483, #1484, #1487) [Bouwe Andela](https://github.com/bouweandela)
- Add DOIs and paper to documentation (#1309,  #1327) [Mattia Righi](https://github.com/mattiarighi)
Add example recipe that extracts a region based on shapefile (#1318) [Bouwe Andela](https://github.com/bouweandela)
- Add plots to quantile bias diagnostic (#1230) [Enrico Arnone](https://github.com/earnone)
- Improve quantile bias documentation (#1428) [Jost von Hardenberg](https://github.com/jhardenberg)
- Add pcrglobwb preprocessing script for eWaterCycle (#1270) [Bouwe Andela](https://github.com/bouweandela)
- Add a tool to test diagnostic script settings (#764) [Bouwe Andela](https://github.com/bouweandela)
- Re-implement RainFARM diagnostic in pure Julia (#1242, #1321) [Jost von Hardenberg](https://github.com/jhardenberg)
- Pull request templates (#1315, #1324, #1397, #1357) [Jaro Camphuijsen](https://github.com/JaroCamphuijsen)
- Reorder recipe perfmetrics diagnostics to optimize runtime (#1326) [Mattia Righi](https://github.com/mattiarighi)
- Update getting started docs for new users (#1330) [Peter9192](https://github.com/Peter9192)
- Fix Flato et al., 2013, IPCC, Fig 9.8 (#1319) [Lisa Bock](https://github.com/LisaBock)
- Upgrade to lintr 2, update R style guide and add recommendation for styler (#1355) [Bouwe Andela](https://github.com/bouweandela)
- Fix provenance of recipe perfmetrics(#1090) [Mattia Righi](https://github.com/mattiarighi)
- Add recipe collins13ipcc (#1310) [Ruth Lorenz](https://github.com/ruthlorenz)
- Fix on CVDP to distinguish inputdata with the same dataset name (#1376) [Björn Brötz](https://github.com/bjoernbroetz)
- Fix to cvdp that data are not overwritten but there for all datasets (#1387) [katjaweigel](https://github.com/katjaweigel)
- multimodel_products diagnostic: added manual option for colorbar (#1368) [Axel Lauer](https://github.com/axel-lauer)
- Port flato13ipcc_9_14 to v2.0 (#1183) [Klaus Zimmermann](https://github.com/zklaus)
- Add recipe sea ice (#888) [DSenftleben](https://github.com/DSenftleben)
- Fixed bug in seaice_tsline.ncl: legend_outside (#1408) [Axel Lauer](https://github.com/axel-lauer)
- Sorting and reordering documentation of the recipes (#1385) [Axel Lauer](https://github.com/axel-lauer)
- Clarify installation instructions for ESMValCore from source (#1389) [Bouwe Andela](https://github.com/bouweandela)
- Add example plots for consecdrydays and shapeselect recipes to documentation (#1381) [PeterBergSMHI](https://github.com/PeterBergSMHI)
- Add documentation for IPCC AR5 fig 9.42a (#1410) [Manuel Schlund](https://github.com/schlunma)
- Removed 'field' check from ipcc_ar5/tsline.ncl diagnostic (#1405) [Lisa Bock](https://github.com/LisaBock)
- Add recipe emergent constraints (#1011) [Axel Lauer](https://github.com/axel-lauer)
- Flexible cmip era validation (#1364) [Valeriu Predoi](https://github.com/valeriupredoi)
- Update ERA-Interim recipes to OBS6 (#1411) [Peter9192](https://github.com/Peter9192)
- Change OBS to OBS6 for ERA-Interim (#1476) [Mattia Righi](https://github.com/mattiarighi)
- Repair autoassess stratosphere (#1417) [Valeriu Predoi](https://github.com/valeriupredoi)
- Update recipes and diagnostics to use simplified fx file definition in recipe (#1272) [Valeriu Predoi](https://github.com/valeriupredoi)
- Updates to recipe_combined_indices.yml (#1362) [Nuria Pérez-Zanón](https://github.com/nperezzanon)
- Multimodel option for Capacity factor recipe (#1276) [Nuria Pérez-Zanón](https://github.com/nperezzanon)
- Port new sea ice diagnostics from v1.0 (#1421) [Axel Lauer](https://github.com/axel-lauer)
- Fix captions of various example figures in documentation (#1427) [Jost von Hardenberg](https://github.com/jhardenberg)
- Improved captions for BSC diagnostics (#1424) [Nuria Pérez-Zanón](https://github.com/nperezzanon)
- Enhancement of the documentation of some recipes (#1439) [Björn Brötz](https://github.com/bjoernbroetz)
- Remove R package ncdf4.helpers from list of dependencies (#1449) [Bouwe Andela](https://github.com/bouweandela)
- Added TCR recipe and fig. 9.42b to Flato13 recipe (#1445) [Manuel Schlund](https://github.com/schlunma)
- Snow-albedo effect (#1435) [Axel Lauer](https://github.com/axel-lauer)
- Add recipe to prepare input for the MARRMoT hydrological model (#1348) [Jaro Camphuijsen](https://github.com/JaroCamphuijsen)
- Add recipe to prepare input for WFlow (#1346, #1458, #1460) [Jaro Camphuijsen](https://github.com/JaroCamphuijsen)
- Extension for histogram and resolution analysis funtionalities and minor improvements (#1463) [Benjamin Müller](https://github.com/BenMGeo)
- Add recipe anav13jclim.yml (#1466) [Manuel Schlund](https://github.com/schlunma)
- Added diagnostic and recipe of Wenzel et al. , J. Climate 29 (2016) (#1448) [Manuel Schlund](https://github.com/schlunma)
- Fixed ECS calculation when no input data is given (#1453) [Manuel Schlund](https://github.com/schlunma)
- Add types of data to README (#1433) [Valeriu Predoi](https://github.com/valeriupredoi)
- Add diagnostic albedolandcover (#1370) [bascrezee](https://github.com/bascrezee)
- Julia example diagnostic and recipe (#1240) [Jost von Hardenberg](https://github.com/jhardenberg)
- Add orcid of some authors to the list (#1474) [SarahAlidoost](https://github.com/SarahAlidoost)
- Diagnostic for multi-model oceanic field maps or bias against observations (#1210) [Tomas Lovato](https://github.com/tomaslovato)
- Add a sea mask to recipe_extreme_index.yml (#1446) [Nuria Pérez-Zanón](https://github.com/nperezzanon)
- Adapt diagnostics to ESMValCore no longer adding auxiliary coordinates (#1485) [Javier Vegas-Regidor](https://github.com/jvegasbsc)
- Add Arctic Ocean diagnostics (#721) [Nikolay Koldunov](https://github.com/koldunovn)
- Rename zonal_means to zonal_statistics (#1491) [Mattia Righi](https://github.com/mattiarighi)
- Continuously check recipe files are well formed (#1213) [Javier Vegas-Regidor](https://github.com/jvegasbsc)
- Porting flato13 fig9.6 to version 2 (#1384) [Bettina Gier](https://github.com/bettina-gier)
- Document how to run multiple recipes via a rose suite (#1262) [Valeriu Predoi](https://github.com/valeriupredoi)
- Fix case of no zero crossings for QBO metric computation (#1290) [Valeriu Predoi](https://github.com/valeriupredoi)

Observational and re-analysis dataset support
- Fixed time coordinate of MTE (#1258) [Manuel Schlund](https://github.com/schlunma)
- Clean up recipe for checking datasets (#1308) [Mattia Righi](https://github.com/mattiarighi)
- Add CMORizer for ERA5 (#1167, #1313, #1325) [Bouwe Andela](https://github.com/bouweandela)
- Add orography to ERA5 CMORizer (#1419) [Peter9192](https://github.com/Peter9192)
- Add longwave radiation and surface pressure to ERA5 CMORizer (#1431) [SarahAlidoost](https://github.com/SarahAlidoost)
- Fix making latitude increasing for ERA5 (#1471) [SarahAlidoost](https://github.com/SarahAlidoost)
- Add CMORizer for CDS satellite lai fapar (#1200) [bascrezee](https://github.com/bascrezee)
- Add CMORizer for duveiller 2018 (#1186) [bascrezee](https://github.com/bascrezee)
- Add CMORizer for NSIDC-0116 (#1066) [Javier Vegas-Regidor](https://github.com/jvegasbsc)
- Add CMORizer for piomas sit reanalysis (#1064) [Javier Vegas-Regidor](https://github.com/jvegasbsc)
- Add CMORizer for NDP (#1379) [Manuel Schlund](https://github.com/schlunma)
- Add CMORizer for HWSD (#1392) [Manuel Schlund](https://github.com/schlunma)
- Add CMORizer for JMA-TRANSCOM (#1399) [Manuel Schlund](https://github.com/schlunma)
- Add CMORizer for fluxcom gpp (#1229) [rswamina](https://github.com/rswamina)
- Add CMORizer for CDS uerra reanalysis (#1275) [bascrezee](https://github.com/bascrezee)
- Add CMORizer for CERES-EBAF Ed4.0 (#1451) [Mattia Righi](https://github.com/mattiarighi)
- Add CMORizer for GCP (#1398) [Manuel Schlund](https://github.com/schlunma)
- Add CMORizer for Merra2 (#1457) [bascrezee](https://github.com/bascrezee)
- Add CMORizer for PHC3.0 (#1459) [Nikolay Koldunov](https://github.com/koldunovn)
- Add CMORizer for OSI-450 dataset (#1042) [Javier Vegas-Regidor](https://github.com/jvegasbsc)
- Re-implement ERA-interim CMORizer in Python and add extra variables (#1297) [Stefan Verhoeven](https://github.com/sverhoeven)
- Add orography, longwave radiation, surface pressure to ERA-interim cmorizer (#1416, #1426) [SarahAlidoost](https://github.com/SarahAlidoost)
- Add CMORizer for ERA-Interim Land (#1338, #1423) [bascrezee](https://github.com/bascrezee)
- Automatic casting of CMORizer output data type (#1402) [Manuel Schlund](https://github.com/schlunma)
- Add logger message telling the user where the cmorizer scripts live (#1464) [Valeriu Predoi](https://github.com/valeriupredoi)
result.name: Version 2 beta release 2

result.description:
This release includes
- Improved documentation
- Recipe Rainfarm is now fully implemented in Julia
- Recipe Diurnal Temperature Index was updated, sea is now masked out
- Recipes Heatwaves/Coldwaves, Toymodel, and Modes of Variability have been improved
- Recipe Autoassess Stratosphere has been improved and documented
- Recipe ZMNAM has better plots
- Added reformatting to CMOR standard for LAI3g, Eppley-VGPM-MODIS datasets
- A mistake was fixed in the units of the CRU dataset reformatting
- Human readable author tags and ORCIDs for many authors
- A bug in the diagnostic shared io module was fixed
- Added citation information
result.name: Version 2 beta release 1

result.description:
This release includes
- [ESMValTool Core](https://github.com/ESMValGroup/ESMValCore) is now a separate package
- More documentation and a gallery with example plots
- Improved capacity factor recipe
- CMORization scripts are now available in esmvaltool/cmorizers and more user friendly
- AR6 color tables and tool
- Python 3.7 conda package
- Unused NCL code was removed
result.name: Version 2 beta release 0

result.description:
This release includes all the work done in the past year.

Major milestones:

- More than 50 recipes are now available, including all diagnostics for the MAGIC project
- In addition to diagnostic scripts in Python and NCL, diagnostics in R and Julia are now also supported
- Provenance information can now be collected and many recipes already use this feature
- Support for more models (CMIP5 and CMIP6) and observational datasets
- Various new preprocessor functions
- Improved reliability
- Contribution guidelines in CONTRIBUTING.md
- More documentation on [readthedocs](http://esmvaltool.readthedocs.io)
- Upgraded to Iris 2
- Dropped support for Python 2
result.name: Version 2 alpha MAGIC release

result.description:
This release includes much of the work done at the recent DLR workshop.

Major milestones:
- We now have eight real recipes (formerly known as namelists) in addition to several example recipes, available in the new version.
- New preprocessor functions for masking by threshold and land/sea.
- New recipe functionality for reading fx-variables
result.name: Version 2 alpha release

result.description: Preview of the upcoming version 2 release.
result.name: Initial version 2 alpha release

result.value:
Diagnostics from ESMValTool are run using [recipe](https://docs.esmvaltool.org/en/latest/recipes/index.html)
files that contain pointers to the requested data types, directives for the preprocessing steps that data
will be subject to, and directives for the actual diagnostics that will be run with the now preprocessed data.
Data preprocessing is done via the [ESMValCore](https://docs.esmvaltool.org/projects/ESMValCore/en/latest/quickstart/index.html) package, a pure Python, highly-optimized scientific library, developed by the ESMValTool core developers,
and that performs a number of common analysis tasks
such as regridding, masking, levels extraction etc. [Diagnostics](https://docs.esmvaltool.org/en/latest/develop/diagnostic.html) are written in a variety of programming languages (Python, NCL, R, Julia) and are developed by the wider
scientific community, and included after a scientific and technical review process.

The easiest way to get help, if you cannot find the answer in the documentation in our [docs](https://docs.esmvaltool.org), is to open an [issue on GitHub](https://github.com/ESMValGroup/ESMValTool/issues).

Please see [getting started](https://docs.esmvaltool.org/en/latest/quickstart/index.html) on our instance of Read the Docs as well as [ESMValTool tutorial](https://tutorial.esmvaltool.org/index.html). The tutorial is a set of lessons that together teach skills needed to work with ESMValTool in climate-related domains.

The easiest way to get help, if you cannot find the answer in the documentation in our [docs](https://docs.esmvaltool.org), is to open an [issue on GitHub](https://github.com/ESMValGroup/ESMValTool/issues).
